newsitem.title: USA: Mayor of Warren, Mich., charged with assault, bias.
newsitem.headline: Mayor of Warren, Mich., charged with assault, bias.

text.p: The mayor of Michigan's third-largest city was arraigned on ethnic intimidation and assault charges Wednesday stemming from his altercation with a black teenager Sept. 11.

Warren Mayor Mark Steenbergh was released on $25,000 personal bond after appearing in 37th District Court to hear the felony ethnic intimidation charge and misdemeanor assault charge filed against him.

Steenbergh, who his white, has acknowledged that he drove to 16-year-old John Harris' neighborhood and confronted the youth after he was told Harris had punched a teenage girl who is a friend of Steenbergh's daughter.
The young man told police Steenburgh choked him, threw him to the grownd and held him. A racial slur was also allegedly used.

Warren, a Detroit suburb with 146,000 residents, is in Macomb County. But Macomb County Prosecutor Carl Marlinga plans to ask St. Clair County prosecutors to handle the matter because he is a long-time friend and supporter of Steenbergh.

Steenbergh could be forced to resign his post if convicted of the felony ethnic intimidation charge, which carries a maximum penalty of two years in prison. The assault and battery charge is punishable by 90 days in jail.
Steenbergh said at a news conference Sept. 13 he would not step down, adding, "I welcome the investigation into this incident. I have nothing to hide."
